intro: Elaeodendron vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Olive, is a flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are typically ovate or elliptical in shape. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are usually yellow or orange when mature. Elaeodendron vitiense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its tropical rainforest habitat.
